alert.note: Alert for De Witt; Logan; McLean; Tazewell (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Central Illinois (Central and East Central Illinois)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 29 at 1:53AM CDT by NWS Central Illinois
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northern Logan, northwestern De Witt, southeastern Tazewell and southwestern McLean Counties through 230 AM CDT... At 153 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Hartsburg, or 8 miles north of Lincoln, moving east at 50 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Armington around 200 AM CDT. Atlanta around 205 AM CDT. McLean around 210 AM CDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Waynesville, Heyworth, Clinton and Wapella. This includes the following highways... Interstate 155 between mile markers 0 and 15. Interstate 55 between mile markers 127 and 152. Interstate 74 between mile markers 142 and 145. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 200 AM CDT for central Illinois.
